title: Lincolnshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: body found after grimsby flat fire .
feline fine on new thatched roof .

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's it from me in the bbc radio lincolnshire newsroom .
harry parkhill will be taking the reins on monday at 08:00 with the latest .
listen live to bbc radio lincolnshire over the weekend when i 'll be reading the news , and keep an eye on this page for any breaking news .
before i go , here 's a look back at what we 've learned today :
have a great weekend !
author: David Sykes
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: 'what a waste of money ' : lincoln reacts to footbridge closure
text: earlier , we told you that lincoln 's high street footbridge is to close for repairs , and people are n't happy .
network rail says its tried to repair the structure several times , but it now needs a longer closure to fix the problems .
but having cost £ 12m , people on facebook have stern words for the company .
here are just a few comments :
why the heck does it need repairing so soon ?
- not like it 's heavily used .
most folks still wait for the barriers .
every time we 've used the lifts they 've been full of litter and worse ''
sounds about right worrying though ''
unbelievable - could n't make it up ''
complete farce ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: brexit 'will impact ' on university of lincoln
text: the university of lincoln will have to renegotiate its student exchange programmes when britain leaves the european union , according to a senior lecturer .
it comes as theresa may tells european leaders that both the uk and eu can be `` optimistic about the future '' .
the university is currently taking part in research schemes and exchange scheme that non-eu states have to pay to be a part of .
professor in public policy , hugh bochel says that the university of lincoln may also have to pay in future
we want to be part of some ongoing eu processes , but we may have to pay .
it will have an impact ''
author: Charlotte Wright
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincoln city condemn attack on mansfield bus
text: lincoln city said it is working with lincolnshire police to try to find the culprits behind the attack on mansfield town 's team bus last saturday .

the bus was targeted by what the red imps describe as `` a small group of youths '' at 16:15 on 23 september when it was at st catherines , leaving the vehicle damaged and some club staff `` distressed '' .
mansfield won the match 1-0 .
lincoln city fully condemns such actions and will fully co-operate with any investigation into the matter ''
author: Rob Makepeace
BBC Radio Lincolnshire sport

documents.title: new footbridge to close for months after being plagued with problems
text: lincoln 's high street footbridge is to close for two months for repairs - just over a year after it first opened .
network rail , who built the bridge at a cost of £ 12m , has tried to repair it several times but says it now needs a longer closure to fix the problems .

the bridge ( above during construction ) was built after a long-running campaign by the city 's former mp karl mccartney , who said it was unacceptable that pedestrians had to wait at the level crossing - which closes several times an hour .
it will close on 1 october .
resurfacing work on the level crossing itself will also take place throughout october .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : a round up of the weekend 's weather
text: here 's a look at the weather for the next few days with me abbie dewhurst :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: man jailed over fatal crash
text: a man has been jailed for two years for causing death by dangerous driving following a crash in which his passenger died .
benjamin hughes , 24 , of nottingham road , lowdham , pleading guilty in august to causing death by dangerous driving and driving with alcohol over the prescribed limit .
dominique wright , 23 , from lincolnshire , was in the vehicle which crashed in southwell road , between high cross and thurgarton village on 30 october .
she died at the scene .
at nottingham crown court earlier , hughes has also been disqualified from driving for four years .
author: Neil Heath
BBC News Online

documents.title: light fantastic future for north lincolnshire 's streets
text: a £ 6m project to replace street lights in north lincolnshire with more energy efficient ones is due to get under way next week .
the council say the new lights will use up to 75 % less energy and save them around £ 500,000 once the work 's done .
it currently costs north linclonshire council £ 1m a year to light our streets .
it 'll take three years to replace all 21,000 light bulbs .
author: Sophia Ewen
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: bat : man to the rescue
text: a small bat has had a `` miraculous '' escape after getting caught in a fishing line .
a passerby found the bat hanging from a tree over a fishing lake in dunholme near lincoln .
it 's thought the bat had been there for about four days .
its thought that the fishing line had become caught in the tree and was cut off , leaving the hook dangling .
amazingly , the bat was n't injured .
rspca inspector stuart wainwright led the rescue :
the poor bat was thrashing around and dangling from the fishing line .
we needed an inflatable boat to be able to float out there , remove the hook and bring him to safety ''
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather : a nice afternoon ahead
text: it 's a lovely afternoon in lincolnshire with plenty of sunshine .
there 's light or moderate southwesterly winds and highs of 16c .
patchy light rain is possible later but it should be a mild night .
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: man in hospital following a180 crash
text: a man has been taken to hospital following a crash near grimsby this morning .
the accident involving two cars happened just off the a180 at the pyewipe roundabout around 06:30 .
a renault megane and an audi q5 collided .
the driver of the renault vehicle was taken to hospital with minor injuries .
author: Jo Makel
BBC Look North

documents.title: behind the scenes during the filming of victoria
text: we 've been given a glimpse behind the scenes of the filming for this weekend 's episode of victoria .
the cast and crew were at harlaxton manor near grantham for a week of filming .
the manor will stand in for a french palace in the programme which is broadcast this sunday at 21.00
author: David Sykes
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: here are the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Charlotte Wright
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: traffic and travel : a1 tailbacks
text: we 've just heard from lincolnshire police about delays on the a1 northbound near grantham .
they say there 's a broken down vehicle at stoke rochford causing long tailbacks .
could take a while to clear .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: fatal house fire in grimsby
text: one person has died in a house fire in grimsby .
fire crews were called to a flat in purbeck road , scartho ( just before 02:00 this morning .
other flats in the building were evacuated and police have confirmed that a body was found in one of the flats .
a cordon is in place and police are investigating .
they want to hear from anyone who was in the area at the time .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: want to tell us about your unsung hero ?
text: do you know someone who helps out at your local sports team or club ?
is this a person who you just could n't cope without ?
t./hen you should think about nominating them for an unsung hero award .
every year the bbc honours the people who volunteer by running sports clubs or leisure activities across east yorkshire and lincolnshire .
last year table tennis coach sylvia worth ( won the award for her work in sancton .
you can nominate your unsung hero by visiting bbc.co.uk/unsunghero .
entries close on the 22 october .
author: Laura Foster
BBC Look North

documents.title: man knocked out and badly injured in boston street brawl
text: a man has needed surgery after he was seriously injured and knocked unconscious in a mass brawl in the centre of boston .
police say a group of women began arguing in the stump & candle pub at around 01:00 before the row spilled out into the street .
police said the 39-year-old man who was injured was taken to hospital and has undergone surgery .
police are looking through cctv and are urging witnesses to come forward .
author: Charlotte Wright
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: save a life : 15,000 people have been trained
text: we 've reached a major milestone in our save a life campaign .
with the help of volunteers from lives first responders and st john 's ambulance , we 've now trained 15,000 people .
there 's lots more ways for you to learn , with events in lincoln and scothern this saturday , and next month , st john 's ambulance will be touring the county with a mobile cpr classroom .
it 's a phenomenal number .
that 's 15,000 people out there with the skills to save somebody 's life .
if you 'd like to take part , email savealife @ bbc.co.uk and you 'll get a reply with all the details .
author: Lucy Parry
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: advice to influx of students about sex and consent
text: with an influx of students in lincoln , police and other agencies are launching a campaign to raise awareness of the law surrounding rape and sexual assault .
i 've been talking to students in lincoln to find out how aware they are of the law :
`` when someone is too drunk , i think it 's easy to notice .
it 's best just to leave it . ''
`` you do find the odd guy who will try it .
at the end of the night , you have guys who will wait until 02:30 to up girls who are so wasted they 'd agree to anything ''
`` i 've heard similar stories of things happening on a night out , but no one talks about it in a serious sense ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: feline fine on new thatched roof
text: the kings head pub in horncastle has had its famous thatch roof replaced , and there 's a small surprise to top it off .
the pub , affectionately known as 'the thatch ' now has a life-size straw cat climbing its chimney .
landlady joanne buckland says the thatch roof is a popular attraction for visitors .
the new thatch should last for 20 to 30 years and was laid by specialist thatchers from cambridgeshire .
but it 's the cat that might steal the show :
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: queen victoria comes to lincolnshire
text: this weekend 's episode of the itv series victoria was filmed in lincolnshire .
harlaxton manor near grantham was transformed into a french palace for the episode .
filming took place over the course of one week .
producer paul frift says the stately home was `` perfect '' for the part .
victoria will be on itv at 21:00 on sunday .
author: David Sykes
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: 'relaxed attitudes ' to sex are a concern for police
text: police and other agencies in lincolnshire are concerned about what they call `` relaxed attitudes '' towards sex .
detective inspector dan boulter leads the serious sexual offences department at lincolnshire police , he says it 's important that consent should be at the forefront of people 's minds .
sexual assault support workers say knowledge of consent issues is worryingly low .
with an influx of students in lincoln for the new school year , authorities are launching a campaign to raise awareness of the law surrounding rape and sexual consent .
there is no need for someone to say no .
there is absolutely no requirement for them to say no .
consent is something that must be agreed before any sexual activity occurs .
author: Lucy Parry
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : what 's the weather got in store for friday ?
text: a dry start but the chance of some rain later .
here 's my full forecast for the day :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: welcome to friday 's live coverage
text: it 's friday !
i 'll be here until 18.00 bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather from around lincolnshire .
you can send me your news , messages and info through email , facebook or twitter .
i 'd especially like to hear from you if you 've got something special planned for this weekend .
author: David Sykes
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's it from me today in the bbc lincolnshire newsroom .
i 'll be back tomorrow from 08.00 with more of the latest .
keep an eye on this page for any breaking news overnight , but in the meantime here 's a look back at what we 've learned today .
and one more thing :
if you 're a fan of a certain historical drama , you might want to check this page tomorrow .
author: David Sykes
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: cycling record attempt comes to scunthorpe
text: cyclist chris hopkinson ( will attempt to beat 11 world records at scunthorpe velodrome next week .
he 's hoping to beat the 24 hour outdoor track world record as well as 10 other records next friday .
author: Caroline Brockelbank
BBC Local Live

documents.title: armed police hunt intruders in grimsby
text: armed police in grimsby are searching for two men who broke into a woman 's house and threatened her last night .
it happened on highfield avenue just before midnight .
the woman who was in the house with her children was left upset and shaken but was n't hurt .
the men drove off in a gold or silver-coloured car and police are appealing for information .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: event encourages next generation of female engineers
text: an event 's been taking place in scunthorpe today to encourage more women to take up engineering roles .
it was at humber utc , an £ 11mfacility focusing on engineering .

it comes as girl guiding release a report finding gender stereotypes are impacting the behaviour of girls as young as seven , which is shutting women out of certain sectors , like engineering and construction .
author: Amanda White
BBC East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: smokey and the bandit taken on by the law
text: lincolnshire police have revealed their softer side : they 've got a pet cat .
earlier this year , skegness police noticed a small , grey cat behind their police station that appeared to be both homeless and pregnant .
the officers clubbed together and began feeding her .
they named her smokey because of her colour and soon later , she gave birth to a kitten they called bandit .
you can read the full story on the lincolnshire police facebook page .
bandit has now been adopted by one of their officers , while smokey has become the station mascot .
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: wrong spelling sign finally comes down after 18 years
text: a lincoln shop-owner admits she has mixed emotions after a sign featuring a comical spelling mistake comes down after 18 years .

in july , lesley richardson who owns the sugarart cake business on the high street told the lincolnshire echo that she knew that `` equipment '' was wrongly spelled `` equiptment '' but kept it in place as it was not cost-effective to take it down .
author: Lincolnshire Echo

documents.title: former vicar jailed over historical sex abuse offences
text: a former lincolnshire vicar has been jailed for six years for historical sex offences .
john bailey , aged 76 , from kippax near leeds , admitted 25 charges of indecent assault on girls under the age of 14 .
the three victims were abused between 1955 and 1982 .
lincoln crown court heard that bailey had recently been diagnosed with alzheimer 's disease and vascular dementia .
he was first arrested as part of lincolnshire police 's operation redstone , which is investigating alleged abuse within the diocese of lincoln .
he was clearly in a position of trust and he abused that trust ''
author: Amanda White
BBC East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: rotary club helps save lives in skegness
text: following the success of our save a life campaign , 13 new defibrillators have been placed in skegness .
the skegness rotary club and local businesses have helped to raise more than £ 26,000 for the equipment .
the club 's president andrew quickfall says this is just the beginning , as they 've already ordered seven more .
the town 's mp , matt warman officially unveiled the new defibrillators :
the rotary club is saving lives it 's a fantastic thing .
we hope to get around 20 defibrillators in and around skegness ''
author: Katie O'Halloran
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather : bring your brolly !
text: it 's looking like it 's going to be a wet afternoon but tomorrow is looking brighter .
here 's the full forecast with me paul hudson :
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: thousands back louth livestock market
text: the results of the public consultation into the future of louth livestock market are in .
of those who responded 84 % chose to keep the market and spend £ 700k on its refurbishment .
east lindsey district council was looking to sell the market and held the consultation to find out people 's views on several options .
of the 4,078 people who took part in the consultation , 3,422 people said that it should be withdrawn from sale and refurbished .
next week , the executive board will discuss the consultation and make a recommendation to the full council when they meet on 11 october .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: petition to cut councillor 's allowances
text: calls are being made for north east lincolnshire councillors allowances to be reduced .
a grimsby man 's got 1,600 people to sign his petition which will be handed over to the council tonight .
he says with cuts to services councillors should take a cut in their allowances too .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: calling all would-be entrepreneurs in grimsby
text: a dragon 's den style competition in grimsby is looking to find the next great business idea .
freshney place shopping centre 's apprentice retailer of the year is on today .
they 'll offer one entrepreneur the chance to bring their idea to life , with a six-month tenancy at a unit within the shopping centre - free of rent , rates and service charges .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: even more nigels found in lincolnshire
text: our facebook and twitter are going bonkers with people telling us about the nigels they know in lincolnshire .
i was on the hunt for a nigel when i found out that the name is dying out but i think it 's safe to say the name is alive and well in lincolnshire .
here 's some more nigels that you 've told us about :
grantham town fc have put forward their own nigel , physio and club stalwart nige marshall :
not one to miss out , horncastle police community support officer nigel wass reports that `` this nigel is still going strong '' :
on facebook , pippa says `` my dad is called nigel !
born in 1962 .
we always laugh when the nigel song comes on the radio '' .
gary says his friend nigel is `` one in a million literally . ''
and the latest in the long line of pets named nigel ; gareth says `` our goldfish is called nigel ''
author: Scott Dalton
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: uk drone pilots could be in line for honours
text: military drone pilots based in lincolnshire who fight so-called islamic state could be awarded medals , the defence secretary has said .
sir michael fallon said there would be a review of how servicemen and women were recognised for contributions to uk operations `` outside the battle space '' .
medals are currently given on the basis of rigour and risk , and when people are physically exposed to danger .
sir michael said a rethink may be needed as the uk increasingly deploys unmanned aircraft on operations .
author: David McKenna
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: calls to scrap bus lanes in grimsby
text: bus lanes in grimsby are a waste of time and causing more congestion .
that 's from a conservative councillor in the town who wants to see a review of bus lanes in grimsby .
ian lyndley will tell full council tonight in north east lincolnshire that he thinks the bus lanes on scartho road ( make traffic worse and there 's no enforcement of them .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: travel : a158 reopened after cement lorry accident
text: the a158 has reopened after a cement lorry overturned at candlesby near spilsby .
the spillage has now been cleared .
to report traffic and travel incidents dial 0330 123 0184 at any time
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: nigel 's making a name for himself
text: apparently the name nigel is dying out , but i 've found lots of nigels in lincolnshire .
people who 've called up to tell me about nigels they know are :
so there are loads of nigels in lincolnshire .
i think my favourite is this chap - kathleen describes him as `` my beautiful nigel '' :
author: Scott Dalton
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: we 're not making plans for nigel
text: we 've been hearing that the name nigel is teetering on the brink of extinction .
well i was wondering if you know any nigels , and so far i 've found quite a few .
one nigel even called me from the netherlands :
author: Scott Dalton
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: plans for large energy plant at orby dropped
text: controversial plans for a large energy plant at orby near skegness have been dropped .
the 1.8 hectare site was part of the triton knoll offshore windfarm .
but the firm behind the project says advances in technology means it no longer has to build it .
a substation will be built though at bicker fen .
the triton knoll wind farm will be built 20 miles off the lincolnshire coast .
the plans envisaged a 60km underground cable linking the turbines to the national grid , a substation at bicker fen , and the now defunct bid for a 1.8 hectare energy plant at orby .
author: Lucy Parry
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: travel : cement spillage blocks road
text: we 've just heard that the a158 is blocked in both directions due to an overturned cement lorry .
it 's thought to have spilled cement on gunby lane between chalk pit lane/monksthorpe lane and back lane .
lincolnshire fire and rescue service are at the scene and the air ambulance is on the way .

documents.title: diabetes rates country 's worst in east lindsey
text: there are more people in east lindsey with diabetes than anywhere else in the country .
health bosses in lincolnshire say more than 11,000 people in the area have the condition , mostly with type 2 , which is often associated with obesity .
latest figures also suggest that 70 % of people in east lindsey are overweight or obese .
off the back of these figures , health authorities as well as the district and county council are thinking of ways to improve people 's lifestyle , health and wellbeing .
they 're collaborating on a 'strategy ' to tackle the problem .
author: David Sykes
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : what 's the weather got in store ?
text: it 's a bit milder than of late but we could see a bit of rain too .
here 's my full forecast :

documents.title: welcome to thursday 's live coverage
text: good morning .
i 'll be here until 18.00 bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather from around lincolnshire .
you can send me your news , messages and info through email , facebook or twitter .
we love to hear from you - especially if your name is nigel .
author: David Sykes
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's all we 've got from the lincolnshire newsroom today - but we 'll be back from 08.00 tomorrow with more of the very latest .
keep an eye here overnight because any breaking news will appear here - but in the meantime let 's look back at five things we 've discovered today :
bye for now !
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: joint raid leads to counterfeit cigarettes discovery
text: a joint operation between lincolnshire trading standards and lincolnshire police has led to the discovery and seizure of thousands of illegal cigarettes .
yesterday , officers from both teams worked together to uncover over 7,000 illegal cigarettes and almost 200 packets of hand rolling tobacco at two stores in gainsborough .
a specialist dog called molly was brought in to help find the cigarettes which were hidden under the counters at shops in the town centre .

joanne hocking , senior trading standards officer , said : `` working together with lincolnshire police and wagtails uk , we can make sure that retailers do n't get away with selling these illegal items . ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: knights brighten up castle grounds
text: earlier we were telling you about the lincoln knights , which spent the summer dotted around lincoln city centre as part of commemorations of the battle of lincoln in 1217 .
they 've been up and all shipped to lincoln castle for the next 10 days - then they 'll be auctioned off for charity .
and as you can see from the video - they 've been attracting a lot of attention from castle visitors .
they 're back !
# lincolnknights
what a wonderful display of lincoln knights .
well done to all concerned .
proud to say ours is there somewhere ! !
yr lovely artistic daughter should get a ibc medal for all the time & effort put in & all for a wonderful cause lest we all forget .

documents.title: non-emergency police line out of action
text: humberside police have tweeted that their non-emergency 101 number is not working properly at the moment .
they stress that the emergency 999 number is unaffected but ask people to only use it if it is a genuine emergency .
we are currently experiencing problems with our 101 line .
999 is unaffected but please only use this number in an emergency .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: roundabout plan unveiled for accident blackspot
text: a junction on the a46 north of lincoln which has a history of serious crashes is to be replaced by a roundabout to improve safety .
the project , for a junction at dunholme , still requires planning permission , but if that is given work should begin in the next few months .
the existing junction has a history of accidents .
combined with poor visibility and significant queues on lincoln road during peak hours , this junction is a prime candidate for improvements ''
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: sport : bignot 's back in the game
text: former grimsby town manager marcus bignot has his first job in football since leaving the mariners .
he 's become manager of national league strugglers chester .
| breaking : we are delighted to announce the appointment of marcus bignot as first team manager .
# coyb
worst day ever
conference north !
we 're havin a laugh
sam are the chester safe financially yet ?
we 're better off than we were a month ago after all this fundraising , just need to make more money every month and carry on raising money now for the rest of the season
scenes when jon wins the lottery and buys chester and leads them to glory
lolol
learnt all he knows from r & dfc
good luck marcus x
good luck marcus !
best wishes .
great appointment for the girls game too in this city .
good manager worked wonders with solihull moors .
good luck to you marcus .
not given a realistic chance at our place # gtfc
@ twitterid marcus bignoot
definitely a non league manager that you have there .
failed at # gtfc did well at solihull so probably found his level .
good luck to you both
a 'none league ' manager is doing quite well at shrewsbury - hopefully marcus does well there and as all us town fans mock fenty , slade
and summerfield we quietly go about the job of obtaining promotion ; and by the time we know it we 're league 1 : - )
fantastic appointment along with @ twitterid only good things to come im sure .
great start as well .
good luck both .
hope he loves your club as much as he loves himself
welcome marcus and good luck to you
good luck biggy .
# qpr # hoopsforever
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: these boots are made for walking
text: dust off your walking boots , south lincolnshire 's walking festival kicks off this weekend .
the south lincolnshire walking festival , is now in its third year .
organisers say the festival is becoming more popular every year .
it 's hoped that it will push bbc radio lincolnshire 's walk a million total past the 500,000 mile mark .
the station is encouraging listeners to send in how many miles they 've walked this week in the hope it encourages them to go out walking .
the tally has just passed 439,000 miles .
if you want to send us your miles , email them here .
author: Melvyn Prior
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: new car park to open in time for christmas - but bus station delayed
text: a 1,000-space multi-storey car park which is being built as part of lincoln 's new £ 30m transport hub will open two months early it 's been announced .
but a new bus station on the same site , which was due to open in december , will now not open until january .
the city of lincoln council , which is leading the project , says it 's decided to concentrate on the car park to bring people in during the christmas shopping period .
the council says the temporary bus station , in the city 's tentercroft street , will now stay in operation for longer , until the new bus station is ready .

we will have to wait until the new year for the hub to be fully open , but it 's essential for city businesses that we prioritise the car park and bring in as many shoppers as possible over the christmas period ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: lorry load of knights arrives at castle
text: they spent the summer on the streets of lincoln - and now they 're being reassembled for one last time before they 're auctioned off for charity .
the lincoln knights made up a trail around the city as part of the commemorations of the battle of lincoln 800 years ago .
i spotted them on a lorry this morning outside the gates of lincoln castle - and you can see them all together in the grounds until the end of the month .
they will be auctioned off at an event at lincoln cathedral on saturday , 30 september to raise money for the nomad trust homeless charity and a new art and innovation fund for lincoln .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: council leader calls for action on grantham hospital
text: lincolnshire 's most senior councillor says possible plans to reintroduce a 24-hour service at grantham hospital need to be brought to fruition quickly .
a report to a council meeting suggests that health bosses are trying to draw up a plan which would offer some sort of night-time service in the town .
a & e was closed 13 months ago because hospital managers said they did n't have enough doctors to safely run the county 's three emergency departments .
councillor martin hill , who leads lincolnshire county council , says he 's been pushing for some kind of extended medical provision overnight at grantham and he expects an announcement by november .
author: David Sykes
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: here are the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: thieves target mobility scooter woman , 86
text: thieves who attacked and robbed an elderly woman in skegness while she was on holiday with her daughter have been described as `` appalling '' by detectives .
the 86-year-old victim was riding her mobility scooter behind her daughter on the corner of algitha road and roman bank in the resort when her handbag was snatched .
police say she tried to fight back as much as she could , but failed to fend off two men who had approached her .
officers are looking for the two men after the incident which happened at around 21.40 last thursday on the corner of algitha road and roman bank in the resort .
this is an appalling crime committed against an elderly lady whilst she was on holiday with her daughter .
this occurred just off one of skegness ' main roads into town and , although late in the evening , i would hope someone has seen something .
even the smallest of detail may help us trace those responsible '' .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: boys in blue go green
text: police in lincolnshire are trialling an electric car as part of plans to make the force the most environmentally-friendly in the uk .
the county 's police and crime commissioner marc jones says he wants operations to be more sustainable - and electric vehicles are part of that .
some forces , like the vatican police , already use electric vehicles like the one below , but mr jones says they 're more likely to be a nissan leaf or similar .
mr jones says he 's also ordered the use of leds when ordinary lightbulbs need replacing and other green measures .
he says it will eventually save money , giving the force more to spend on crime-fighting .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: police chief targets town 's drug problem as priority
text: there 's a fresh dawn over grimsby 's east marsh as a new chief of police in northern lincolnshire vows to take the drug dealers out .
over the last few months there have been a number of drugs raids in grimsby 's east marsh , where residents have described living in fear .
ch supt christine wilson says humberside police is focused on wiping-out the problem and taking apart organised crime gangs .
author: Amanda White
BBC East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: appeal after 'deliberate ' dog attack on sheep
text: police have appealed for help after they were called to a sheep which appeared to have suffered what they called a `` deliberate dog attack '' .
officers say they think the incident happened between 16.00 yesterday and 09.00 today in a field off copper street , bucknall , near horncastle .
anyone with information should contact lincolnshire police on 101 .

documents.title: happy birthday to grimsby police station
text: grimsby 's police station is 60 years old today .
it was built with 14 cells for men and 6 for women and all the mod cons of 1950 's policing .
there were 168 sergeants and constables .
six of those were women .
there were 195 special officers .
i went along to a celebration at the police station yesterday and met 86-year-old len rayner , one of the original serving officers .
len told me he worked here till he retired in 1983 and says in those days , because they walked the streets , they saw much more than if they were in a car .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: gardening equipment stolen during raid
text: police have appealed for help to track down gardening equipment which was stolen in a raid on a property in spalding .
they 've just issued these in the hope that somebody may have had them offered for sale .
police say the thieves forced their way into a container on monks house lane , spalding on 5 september .
if you see these items for sale or know anything about their whereabouts then please get in touch .
like any sort of burglary , this crime has had a real impact on the victim , their family and their livelihoods .

documents.title: misconduct hearing in immingham for four councillors
text: accusations of misconduct against four immingham town councillors will be heard today .

a standards hearing panel at north east lincolnshire council will be held after a number of complaints were made against the behaviour of councillors dave watson , mike burton , kevin houghton and david bolton by the town council clerk .
they deny the claims by dave jackson that they 've been undermining him and the council .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: police chief : i 'll stamp out drug problems
text: the police chief taking over responsibility for northern lincolnshire says she 's committed to removing drug dealers from local communities .
over the past few months there have been a number of drugs raids in grimsby 's east marsh area ( below ) , where residents have described living in fear .
supt christine wilson says humberside police is focused on wiping-out the problem .
we will do drugs raids every day of the week , if that is what it takes to get them off our streets .
they damage people 's lives and families . ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: late summer sunrise gives us a warm glow
text: here are a couple of from my commute through lincolnshire this morning - i just had to stop and capture the sunrise :
author: Melvyn Prior
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: round-the-clock health plan on the cards for grantham
text: a 24-hour service at grantham hospital could be in place by winter .
health trusts are collaborating to bring in a temporary measure that would replace an overnight a & e service which closed 13 months ago .
campaigners from two groups which have been calling for the re-introduction of 24-hour care in the town have given the scheme a cautious welcome .
but they also say the plan is currently `` light on detail '' and they 're concerned that there wo n't be the right staff to deal with genuine medical emergencies .
author: David Sykes
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : a bright day on the way
text: any patchy rain soon dying out this morning then all parts should be dry with bright or sunny spells developing .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: welcome to wednesday 's live coverage
text: good morning from lincoln .
i 'll be here until 18.00 today with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county .
we love to hear from you , so get in touch by sending an email , or messaging on facebook or twitter .
send in your news or info about what 's happening where you are and we 'll try and give you a mention here .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: five things we learned today
text: that 's it for our live coverage of lincolnshire 's news today but we 'll be back tomorrow .
in the meantime , i 'll leave you with five things we did n't know this morning :
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: lost wedding bracelet 'found at waste centre '
text: a lady from grantham has been reunited with her precious wedding bracelet after it was found by workers at a tip .
kath groom lost the bracelet after dropping off some gardening waste at grantham 's household waste recycling centre .
`` i was absolutely gutted when i realised the bracelet was missing .
after i double-checked everything - the reality that i had actually lost it hit me .
i retraced my steps and even went back to the tip to ask if anyone had seen it , but unfortunately no one had .
i went home thinking it was lost forever ''
but on a second visit to the tip a fortnight later , she was reunited with the bracelet after one of the workers overheard her talking about it .
`` the chaps at the tip were absolutely marvellous and a credit to the organisation - i will always be grateful to them , '' kath said .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather : chance of the odd bit of rain
text: it will turn cloudy tonight with perhaps a few spots of rain for a time and lows of around 9c ( 48f ) .
tomorrow could see a damp start in some places , otherwise it will be a mostly dry and bright day with sunny spells .
it will feel warm with highs around 19c ( 66f ) .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: dozens of football fans guilty of affray
text: two police officers were injured in clashes at a pre-season grimsby town and sheffield united match .

documents.title: rail firm says 'no cash available ' for lift access at bridge
text: network rail says it ca n't afford to build a footbridge over a railway line in lincoln if it has to include a lift .
there 's already a footbridge over the level crossing on lincoln 's high street but there were plans for a crossing over the railway line at the brayford wharf ( below ) .
city of lincoln council rejected the plans because they did n't include a lift .
an appeal is in process but rachel lowe from network rail says that if the appeal fails they may `` have to consider '' not building the footbridge at all .
the design that is on the table is one that could have lifts fitted in the future should funding become available ''
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : event to reduce fatal bike accidents
text: more now on this event aimed at reducing motorcycle deaths on lincolnshire 's roads .
a third of the deaths on our roads in the last year included a motorbike :
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincolnshire school downgraded by ofsted
text: a boston school has had its ofsted rating downgraded from `` good '' to `` requires improvement '' .

giles academy in old leake , near boston , was criticised for having maths and science grades below the national average for `` too long '' ; and for the performance of 6th form students being `` too low '' in academic subjects .
the report also said that `` far too many '' pupils were skipping school or turning up late for lessons .
but the 970 pupil school is praised for being a `` harmonious community '' where pupils are taught to respect one another .
the school also received approval for supporting pupils who speak english as a second language .
we intend to use the report and the comments made by ofsted to implement changes to the school to make this a better school for all of our students .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: slow traffic after a1 crash
text: oakham police are dealing with this crash on the a1 northbound near thistleton .
they have said there are no injuries but traffic is slow .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'syringe threat ' thief jailed for 14 months
text: a thief who threatened staff at a shop with a syringe has been jailed for 14 months .
adam bolland , aged 26 , of no fixed address , pleaded guilty to affray and theft during an incident on 15 august .
the court heard that bolland ( below ) was aggressive and violent after being confronted over stealing a bottle of whisky and razor blades from the supermarket on tritton rd , lincoln .
bolland also pleaded guilty to six other charges of theft from other stores between 22 july and 13 august .
he reached into his pocket and pulled out a syringe .
he started pointing it towards staff telling them to back off , or he would stab them ''
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: county police sees rise in complaints
text: there 's been a nine per cent rise in complaints against lincolnshire police , according to new figures .
figures from the independent police complaints commission show that 596 people made complaints against the force , that 's a rise on the previous year .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: five charged over sale of 'legal highs '
text: five people have been arrested in connection with the sale of so-called legal highs in the centre of lincoln .
police raided a property and the five were charged with possession with intent to supply .
supt lee pache described it as an `` excellent result '' , and said that the main target of the operation was caught along with four others .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: hull-based sailing charity to help grimsby families
text: the hull-based sailing charity catzero ( that helps young unemployed people is going to start working with vulnerable families in north east lincolnshire .
they 've teamed up with grimsby based cpo , which helps families approaching crisis .
and they 've got £ 340,000 from the big lottery fund to help improve the lives of 100 families in grimsby 's east marsh , west marsh and south wards over the next three years .
author: Carl Wheatley
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: blood bike 's life support for air ambulance
text: an emergency blood bike team has been drafted in to help transport supplies to lincolnshire 's air ambulance .
it 's hoped that the scheme will save lives by transporting supplies quickly along the county 's rural road network .
last week we told you that lincolnshire 's `` ambucopter '' has become one of the first in the country to have blood on board .
the team of volunteers on the bike team say it 's quicker to transport the blood on the bikes than using more conventional means .
united lincolnshire hospitals trust says that long distances between hospitals makes having blood on the helicopter a life saving tool :
because we 've got so far to travel between hospitals and between the trauma centre at nottingham it can help get the patient to nottingham in a more stable position ; so it would save lives .
author: Katie O'Halloran
Reporter - BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: your headlines this afternoon
text: a quick recap of some of the stories making the news this morning :
author: Alex Rhodes
Newsreader - BBC Lincolnshire

documents.title: rail strike to affect lincolnshire services
text: rail passengers are facing disruption in lincolnshire after a union announced two more days of strike action .
services between lincoln , gainsborough and sheffield will be affected on tues october 3 and thurs october 5 .
unions say they 're `` angry and frustrated '' at the situation .
it 's as part of an ongoing dispute between the rmt and arriva rail north ( over safety claims .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: man dies after single vehicle crash in grimsby
text: a man 's died after the car he was in left the road and hit a tree in grimsby .
the 27-year-old was a passenger in the car when it crashed just after 19:00 on saturday evening on tetney road in humberston .
the driver of the blue volvo v40 and two other passengers suffered minor injuries and were treated at the scene .
police are asking for anyone with information to get in touch via the 101 number .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: lincolnshire 's military wives to commemorate end of world war one
text: look out ed sheeran , lincolnshire 's military wives are on your tail .
singers from the county 's military wives choirs are contributing to a special album to mark the 100th anniversary of the end of world war one , due to be released late next year .
the military wives choirs reached number one with their 2012 album in my dreams .
singers from raf waddington , cranwell , coningsby , digby , & scampton will be taking part .
the commemorative album will include contributions from all the military wives choirs in the uk .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: concern over missing man from scunthorpe
text: police are concerned for the safety of a missing scunthorpe man because he may be in need of medical attention .
christian thompson , aged 44 , ( from the town was last seen on saturday at 13:00 bst .
humberside police say he may have travelled to scarborough .
he is around 6ft tall of thin build and bald and was last seen wearing a baseball cap , grey hooded top with blue jeans and trainers .
police are urging anyone with information to get in touch .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: crematorium plans go on display
text: plans for a £ 6m crematorium near gainsborough go on display today .
the local council is proposing to create space in the village of lea .
currently families have to travel to either for scunthorpe or lincoln for cremations .
the consultation period ends next month , you can have your say here .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: court appearance for football hooligans
text: seventeen men are due at hull crown court today following trouble at a grimsby town pre-season friendly match in july .
they were charged with violent disorder offences when they clashed with sheffield united supporters and humberside police after the game .
two police officers were injured during the disturbance .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: abnormal load heading towards brigg
text: if you get stuck in traffic between immingham and brigg this morning - this could be why :
humberside police say the abnormal load is 300 tonnes in weight , 52 metres long and four metres wide !
expect delays .
# abload movement travelling from immingham to brigg this morning .
route is a160 , a180 , m180 then a18 into brigg and then towards scawby # 79
300 tonnes in weight , 52 metres long , 4 metres wide .
it 's going to be a slow mover .
expect delays in the area .
what is your eta for brigg / scawby please ?
so i can avoid you
about 2-3 hours depending on traffic congestion .
thank you i will go now and get my jobs done
good luck with that kate i 'm sticking with hull today
cheers !
at least i have a good time frame to avoid such large load if i get my skates on lol x
do n't envy anyone getting caught up with that on the roads stay safe @ twitterid
legend
what a funny bloke
nice stance of the motorbike police man
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: `` exceptionally rare '' crucifix found on coast
text: a rare crucifix found on the lincolnshire coast is from an `` archaeologically invisible '' era of history , according to an expert .
the artefact ( which was found in skidbrooke near louth , is thought to be almost a thousand years old .
it 's been dated as being from between 950-1150ad .
archaeologist adam daubney says it 's an `` exceptionally rare '' item because discoveries from anglo saxon times are few and far between .
he says the find is one of only three found in the uk from the time period .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: safety event to counter motorbike deaths
text: a safety event to tackle the growing number of motorcyclists killed on lincolnshire 's roads begins today .
nine motorcyclists have been killed on the county 's roads this year .
the event , which takes place at cadwell park in the lincolnshire wolds ( will teach bikers how to brake effectively , take corners more safely and about crash analysis .
they are so vulnerable on the roads .
the slightest mishap can lead to death or serious injury .
so we see this as key for all riders .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: huge road resurfacing scheme begins
text: engineers have started work on one of the county 's biggest road resurfacing jobs .
three miles of road surface on the b1397 is being replaced between gosberton and sutterton , near boston .
the county council says it 'll take a fortnight to complete the work and cost £ 500,000 .
one local resident said the roadworks would be `` very annoying '' but another conceded the existing road was `` a hazard as it was '' .
county councillor richard davies says it 's about time saving .
the council plan on filling potholes less and resurfacing roads more , that 's why it 's going to take so long :
if rome was built in a day , we 'd have used their contractors , but we 're not able to .
author: Hope Bolger
Reporter - BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : what 's the weather got in store today ?
text: a fine day after a chilly start .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: good morning and welcome to tuesday 's live coverage
text: good morning from our lincolnshire newsroom it 's harry here guiding you through today 's live coverage .
i 'll have all of your sports , travel , weather updates and , of course , the latest news from our fine county .
if you fancy getting in touch , why not drop me an email , or send us a message on facebook or twitter .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's it from me today .
but before i leave , here are five things we 've learned :
have a good evening .
our local live coverage continues at 8am tomorrow .
author: David Sykes
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincoln v mansfield disturbance : two people charged are named .
text: two people charged in connection to the disturbance at lincoln city 's game against mansfield town this weekend have been named .
they are :
during the game , two flares were thrown onto the pitch .
author: Rob Makepeace
BBC Radio Lincolnshire sport

documents.title: arts in lincolnshire given £ 700k boost
text: close to £ 700,000 has been awarded by the national lottery to a three year arts programme in lincoln
lincoln arts trust is leading the project with the university of lincoln .
organisers say it will help transform the city through a range of world class artistic events .

lincoln is a city steeped in history and this investment presents a really exciting opportunity to celebrate and showcase lincoln through a range of world-class artistic events we hope to see this investment helping to fuel future growth in the local visitor economy , attracting tourists from across england and beyond .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: be careful in the kitchen
text: after attending five kitchen fires over the weekend , lincolnshire fire & rescue are urging people to be more careful while cooking .
thankfully , fire alarms had alerted the residents in time and only one man had to be treated for smoke inhalation .
two of the fires were caused by toast being left in a toaster for too long .
the fire service says you should `` never leave cooking unattended '' , `` do n't cook if you feel tired or fatigued '' , and `` ensure smoke alarms are fitted '' .
since two of the fires were caused by burning toast , it 's probably also worth adding another warning of our own : do n't burn the toast !
author: David Sykes
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: the headlines this evening
text: here are the headlines from look north this evening .
the latest headlines from the @ twitterid team with @ twitterid more on bbc one @ 18:30 .
peter , should n't the council sort out the a63 before undertaking another big project that will lead to more traffic chaos ?
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: `` lincolnshire is in safe hands ''
text: the assistant chief constable of lincolnshire police has thanked his colleagues and members of the public for their support following the parsons green attack .

now that the terror alert level has been lowered to 'severe ' and the armed officers from the civil nuclear constabulary have left lincolnshire , acc shaun west had a reassuring message for the county :
our officers will continue with increased patrols this week and please continue to report anything sus or of concern to them .
i would like to thank the public for remaining vigilant and for understanding that their safety is our primary concern .
maybe he 's feeling relaxed after that big breakfast he had earlier .
breakfast with @ twitterid this morning before waving them away back home after a hearty breakfast .
thank you on behalf of @ twitterid
oh come on !
surely # lincolnshiresausages were used in this full english ?
looks very mass produced one to me ?
you need a decent butcher
hi nick .
i ca n't share the provenance of said sausages ( i do n't know ) but personally always prefer # lincolnshiresausages
have to keep looking after these # vip visitors and promote our wonderful local foods at same time .
keep up good work
yessss !
author: David Sykes
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: they 're red good
text: the red arrows have been showing off their latest moves in greece for the athens flying week .
check out these photos on their official facebook page :
author: David Sykes
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: two charged after disturbance at lincoln city match
text: two adults have been charged in relation to a disturbance at the lincoln city v mansfield town match this weekend .
a 14 year old has also entered the youth referral scheme .
two flares were thrown onto the pitch during the game .
author: Rob Makepeace
BBC Radio Lincolnshire sport

documents.title: road reopens after diesel spill
text: the b1398 has reopened after 4 cars came off the road following a diesel spill .
some of the cars ended up in ditches or in fields after losing grip on the road between kirton in lindsey and hemswell .
i spoke to some of the drivers who came off the road :
author: Simon Spark
Video Journalist

documents.title: lincolnshire 's beautiful skies
text: let 's see some more of the gorgeous photos that have been submitted to be in next year 's lincolnshire skies calendar .
starting with this one from jake robinson :
the team at fenpeas near boston are looking very cool in this early morning snap :
you can see all 12 winning photos on the lincolnshire skies website .
all the proceeds are going to support the lincolnshire & nottinghamshire air ambulance .

documents.title: news headlines
text: let 's take you through the top stories this afternoon in lincolnshire :
author: Alex Rhodes
Newsreader, Lincolnshire

documents.title: celebrating lincolnshire 's big skies
text: more than 100 photos have been submitted for a calendar celebrating lincolnshire 's skies .
the calendar is to be sold for charity , raising money for the lincolnshire and nottinghamshire air ambulance .
people have sent in their best snaps from all over the county .
now all of the entries have to be whittled down to the final 12 .
the main organiser , rachel rogers says she 's been `` bowled over '' by the number of entries .
i 'll share some more of these amazing photos with you later on , but you can see the full shortlist on the lincolnshire skies website .

documents.title: new lincoln fun bus promises perfect parties for fun-loving families
text: a fun bus packed full of obstacles for children to clamour over will officially launch in lincoln next month .
author: Lincolnshire Echo

documents.title: nuclear site protection police leave lincolnshire
text: it 's understood that the civil nuclear police who 've been in lincolnshire over the weekend have been stood down .
the armed police normally guard nuclear power stations around the country .
the officers were deployed in the wake of the london tube attack , when the uk terror alert was raised to 'critical ' .
yesterday , the threat level was altered to 'severe ' .
there 's been glowing praise for the nuclear officers from superintendent phil vickers :
while assistant chief constable shaun west enjoyed a big breakfast with them before they left :
grateful for the friendly , professional support from @ twitterid officers patrolling lincs # actioncountersterrorism @ chestermansimon
thank you all for your hard work , not easy for you all or your families .
stay safe !
my thoughts and thanks are with you all
breakfast with @ twitterid this morning before waving them away back home after a hearty breakfast .
thank you on behalf of @ twitterid
oh come on !
surely # lincolnshiresausages were used in this full english ?
looks very mass produced one to me ?
you need a decent butcher
hi nick .
i ca n't share the provenance of said sausages ( i do n't know ) but personally always prefer # lincolnshiresausages
have to keep looking after these # vip visitors and promote our wonderful local foods at same time .
keep up good work
yessss !
author: David Sykes
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: rise in visitor numbers to cleethorpes
text: there 's been a 10 % rise in visitor numbers to cleethorpes this summer compared to last year .
that 's what the leader of north east lincolnshire council has told us .
it comes as businesses in the resort say they 've seen an increase in trade too .
there were originally fears that tourism numbers could be hit because of the closure of the pleasure island theme park .
author: Caroline Brockelbank
BBC Local Live

documents.title: scunthorpe rooftop man in court
text: a man who took to the roof of a house in a bid to escape police arrest has admitted a number of offences .
kyle ferguson , 23 , of salisbury close , scunthorpe , was wanted by humberside police and was detained after a rooftop stand-off near his home last month .

at grimsby crown court today he pleaded guilty to various charges including three counts of affray , one count of racially or religiously aggravated intentional harassment and another of having a blade or sharply pointed article in a public place .
ferguson has been remanded in custody until 29 september when he is due to be sentenced at the same court .
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC News Online

documents.title: dummy whales and dolphins 'rescued '
text: dummy whales and dolphins 'rescued '

documents.title: weather : rain is on the way
text: if you 're planning to get out and about , now 's the time .
it 's cloudy and dry this afternoon , but there 'll be showers in the early evening .
those showers could be heavy for some , so i 'd recommend walking the dog sooner , rather than later .
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: teenager treated in hospital after grantham stabbing
text: a teenager has been stabbed in grantham
the 17-year-old boy is in hospital , but his injuries are not thought to be life-threatening .
police were called to a reported stabbing at 15.02 on sunday .
lincolnshire police are appealing for witnesses , who should call 101 quoting incident number 265 .
author: David Sykes
Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: cars crash off road in oil spill
text: a suspected oil spill has caused four vehicles to come off the road and three others to spin out of control near kirton lindsey in north lincolnshire .
there was one minor injury to one person .
the road has been closed to allow the vehicles to be recovered and the road cleaned .
author: Simon Spark
Video Journalist

documents.title: watch : inflatable whales 'rescued ' on lincolnshire beach
text: here 's more on those inflatable whales that were spotted on trusthorpe beach at the weekend .
they were being used for a training exercise by the charity , british divers marine life rescue .
it 's easy to see why some people mistook them for real whales !
author: David Sykes
Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: grimsby mp wants 'positive ' changes at health trust
text: grimsby 's mp wants to see lasting changes in the trust that runs hospitals in the town , as well as scunthorpe and goole .
in april , the northern lincolnshire and goole hospital trust ( nlag ) became the first trust in the country to re-enter special measures after inspectors found patient safety and care had worsened .
melanie onn has met senior health officials in government seeking reassurances over a turnaround .
coming out of special measures should not be the sole objective .
the objective has to be about making sure there is improvement and that improvement is properly embedded .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: listen : former chief inspector reviews his 30 years in the force
text: mark garthwaite , a chief inspector who retired last week after 30 with lincolnshire police has been reflecting on the highs and lows of his career .
he admitted that it 's `` scary '' that the population has grown but the number of police officers has n't , and he said he does n't envy the police officers of today .
he praised the hard work of his colleagues , and said he 's leaving the force at the top of his game .
here 's my interview with him in full :
he wo n't be able to relax completely though , he 's coming back to the force soon to work in a civilian capacity .
he also said his wife has given him a long list of jobs to keep him busy .
author: Scott Dalton
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: lack of computer skills is 'shutting people out ' of the jobs market .
text: one in four people in lincolnshire do n't know how to write and send an email , according to government figures .
there are fears the lack of basic it knowledge is stopping people from getting jobs and it might affect them when changes to the benefits system come into place .
universal credit , which is replacing some benefits and tax credits next month , is administered online by claimants .
it 's claimed some people do n't feel they need to learn how to use a computer , while others blame poor internet access across the county .
author: Sharon Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : jurassic steams back into lincolnshire
text: the 114-year-old steam locomotive , jurassic , has begun pulling passenger trains for the first time in 20 years .
the lincolnshire coast light railway trust has been restoring the engine for the past few years , thanks to lottery funding and public donations .
it was once used to move potatoes , and was even used in france during world war one .
you can hop on board yourself at skegness water leisure park .
looks great , does n't it ?
author: Lucy Parry
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: inflatable whales 'rescued ' from lincolnshire beach
text: did you see the fake whales in lincolnshire yesterday ?
they were being used for a simulated mass stranding at trusthorpe beach .
two years ago , three sperm whales washed up on lincolnshire 's beaches , so these fake whales will help prepare teams in case it happens again .
the stranding exercise was being staged by british divers marine life rescue , which has 3,500 volunteers around the uk .
admittedly , it gave us quite a shock when someone called up thinking they were real !
author: Lucy Parry
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : what 's the weather got in store ?
text: a dry , bright start for most .
some showers are expected later .

documents.title: welcome to monday 's live coverage
text: good morning from lincoln .
i 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across yellow-belly county today until 18.00 .
we love to hear from you , so get in touch with us through facebook or twitter .
you can send us your news or information on things that are happening in the county and we 'll try and include it here .
author: David Sykes
Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire
